container.heading: Centers for Children with Acute Illness

section.heading: Location of Center.
section.text: An office may issue a license for a room in a child care center or for an entire center offering care to children with acute illness.

section.heading: Applicability of Subtitle.
section.text: An applicant for a center offering care under this chapter shall meet the requirements of this subtitle with the exception of:

para.text: COMAR 13A.16.05.12 concerning outdoor activity areas;
COMAR 13A.16.09.01 concerning schedule of daily activities for all children;
COMAR 13A.16.09.03B(1) and (2) concerning activity materials and equipment;
COMAR 13A.16.09.05A concerning carriages and strollers, if care is provided to children younger than 2 years old;
COMAR 13A.16.10.01A(3)(c) concerning emergency evacuation and disaster drills for children; and
COMAR 13A.16.11.01 concerning exclusion for acute illness.
An applicant for a center offering care under this chapter shall:

Submit to and receive prior approval from the office, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Health and the health officer, of a written plan of operation for the center, including provision for health assessment of ill children; and
Operate according to the approved plan.
An applicant shall include in the written plan of operation:
Procedures to prevent the spread of disease, including general infection control procedures and methods of preventing the spread of airborne diseases, such as chicken pox and measles;
Staff training requirements in the areas of prevention and control of communicable diseases and care of ill children;
Staff education and experience in the health care field;
Staff orientation in pediatric first aid, infection control, and facility policies;
Staff/child ratios;
The identity of an on-call health consultant;
A definition of the population to be served and the criteria for admission, including exclusion policies;
Procedures for preparing a written plan of care for each child upon admission to include instructions for care in emergencies, medications, and special medical and nonmedical treatments;
Procedures for periodic reassessment of the child;
Methods for establishing an individualized program of daily activities for each child;
Staff information, including a staffing pattern;
A list of materials, equipment, and furnishings; and
Identification of buildings and rooms to be used for the program.

section.heading: Director Requirements.
section.text: The director in a center for children with acute illness shall:

para.text: Meet the requirements of COMAR 13A.16.06.05, .06, .07, or .08, as applicable; and
Have completed at least 40 hours of training in a college level course in prevention and control of communicable diseases and care of ill children.

section.heading: Use of Health Consultant.
section.text: An operator shall use a health consultant who is a registered nurse, a pediatric or family nurse practitioner, or a pediatrician to develop written policies and procedures and to supervise and instruct staff on performing procedures.
